intro: Psychotria sororopanensis, commonly known as the Panamá psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
